Ladies and gentlemen, the response "I would love to see that one! I would love to see it!" is an incredibly engaging response that can help keep a conversation going. It is important to note that engagingness is not just about providing relevant and coherent statements, but also about creating a positive atmosphere that encourages further discussion. 

In this case, the response is not only enthusiastic but also demonstrates an interest in learning more about the topic. It can help to spark curiosity among the participants and encourage them to share their thoughts and opinions. Additionally, the use of an exclamation mark adds a sense of excitement and energy to the conversation. 

Moreover, the response does not shut down the conversation but rather invites further discussion by expressing a desire to learn more. This can help to keep the conversation flowing and prevent it from becoming dull or stagnant. 

In conclusion, the response "I would love to see that one! I would love to see it!" is an engaging and positive response that can help to maintain a lively conversation. It invites further discussion and demonstrates an interest in learning more about the topic.

: I respectfully disagree with my opponent's viewpoint. While enthusiasm and positivity can certainly contribute to an engaging conversation, the response "I would love to see that one! I would love to see it!" lacks substance and depth. 

It is important to note that engagingness should not come at the cost of relevance and coherence. The response, while expressing interest, does not add any value to the ongoing conversation. It does not offer any new insights, facts or perspectives on the topic. 

Furthermore, the response can be interpreted as a diversion tactic, where the participant uses enthusiasm and excitement to avoid responding to the topic at hand. This can be frustrating and counterproductive for the participants who want to engage in a meaningful conversation. 

Moreover, the use of an exclamation mark can be seen as an attempt to create false enthusiasm or over-exaggeration, which can come across as insincere or even annoying to some participants. 

In conclusion, while enthusiasm and positivity are important qualities in an engaging conversation, they should not be used as a substitute for substance and relevance. The response "I would love to see that one! I would love to see it!" lacks depth and can be interpreted as a diversion tactic.

[Rebuttal]: Respectfully, I disagree with my opponent's argument. While the response may not offer new insights, it does demonstrate an interest in the topic at hand. This interest can help to keep the conversation going and encourage other participants to share their thoughts and opinions. 

Furthermore, the use of an exclamation mark can be seen as a genuine expression of enthusiasm and excitement, rather than an attempt to create false enthusiasm. It adds energy to the conversation and can help to create a positive atmosphere. 

Additionally, the response does not divert from the topic at hand but rather expresses a desire to learn more about it. This can lead to further discussion and exploration of the topic. 

In conclusion, the response "I would love to see that one! I would love to see it!" may not offer new insights, but it does demonstrate an interest in the topic and can help to keep the conversation going in a positive direction.

hello did you know that 80 percent of the earths natural forests have already been destroyed ? 
 i heard it but i 'm skeptical . that sounds far too high and what 's the definition of " natural . 
 not sure in this case . when the earth was formed the days were only 5.5 hours long ! 
 that was 5.5 hours of sunlit hell in magma and lava . bummer , they are saying we will be out of helium by the end of the century .
